CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| HOMO |
| LUMO |
| PCBM |

Note:

* HOMO stands for highest occupied molecular orbital
* LUMO stands for lowest unoccupied molecular orbital
* PCBM stands for [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, a common electron acceptor material used in organic solar cells.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to material names, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCBM |

Note:

* PCBM stands for [6,6]-phenyl-C61-butyric acid methyl ester, a common electron acceptor material used in organic solar cells.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| HOMO | Highest occupied molecular orbital |
| LUMO | Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital |
| carrier mobility | High and balanced carrier mobility |
| solubility | Soluble in common organic solvent |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| HOMO | Highest occupied molecular orbital |
| LUMO | Lowest unoccupied molecular orbital |

The following entities do not clearly refer to "Value of material property":

* "carrier mobility" (this refers to the ability of charge carriers to move through the material, not a specific property value)
* "solubility" (this refers to the ability of the material to dissolve in a solvent, not a specific property value)

Therefore, the valid entities that clearly refer to "Value of material property" in the given paragraph are:

* HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital)
* LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital)
